name: Salma Mozaffari
main: Dr. Salma Mozaffari holds a Ph.D. in Structural Engineering from ETH Zurich in Switzerland and a Master of Science in Structures from Northeastern University in Boston. Her research experience includes computational structural design and optimization, algebraic geometry, and signal processing for structural dynamics and health monitoring applications. She is also interested in interdisciplinary research at the interface of digital fabrication and resource-aware construction. Dr. Mozaffari also has dynamic professional experience in the United States and Switzerland, where she worked on various projects, including the design, rehabilitation, and inspection of buildings and bridges.
sub: At ADR, Dr. Mozaffari will serve as a co-lead on two research projects; 1. structural engineering and optimization of robotically fabricated timber structures for building-scale construction, and 2. characterization, optimization, and structural experimentations of the Cocoon reinforced concrete elements fabricated through 3D-printing of clay formwork.
